revised_title: Geological Evolution of Tibet: Plutonic Rocks of the 1985 Tibet Geotraverse
tldr: This article describes the geological evolution of Tibet, focusing on the plutonic rocks of the 1985 Tibet Geotraverse. It discusses the petrology, geochemistry, and petrogenesis of three major plutonic belts in the Lhasa, Qiangtang, and Kunlun Terranes. The study provides insights into the formation and evolution of the Tibetan Plateau and its tectonic history.
